name: Mercure Farnham Bush Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed last Saturday for a friend's wedding. The hotel was pretty and the room was nice - though there was evidence that it hadn't been cleaned as well as it could have; there was an open, unlidded shower gel bottle still in the shower.
reviews.title: One Egg!
Perfect setting
reviews.text: Breakfast on the busy Sunday morning was a bit of a shambles - the staff huffed and puffed and we waited an inordinate time for our cooked "country" breakfast before a waiter came over to ask (again) if we had ordered. When it did arrive, my "country" breakfast (listed on the menu as a full english) came with one poached egg, one sausage, two slim rashers of bacon, one mushroom and one half grilled tomato. We paid the full B&B rate of £118, but if I had paid the separate £15 breakfast charge I would have been disgusted (I was anyway). We all know breakfasts don't cost that much to cater, and fair enough there was a buffet - but that had run dry when we arrived at 9.50 (breakfast ran till 10.30 - there was little in the way of replenishment). They clearly cannot cope with large amounts of guests - but for a successful and reasonably pricey hotel in a major wedding catchment area I was not impressed at all.

I booked this through Lastminute for a bargain £53 for the two of us, including breakfast. What a lovely hotel, bang in the centre of Farnham, within easy walking distance of the many pubs and restaurants. Our room was very traditional, and very comfy with all the amenities you would expect of a 4* hotel. It had a trouser press, free bottled sparkling and still water, herbal teas/normal tea/coffee, and hot chocolate. The breakfast was a treat, in a beautiful room with chandaliers. It's coming up to Christmas and it was tastefully decorated, not tacky. The buffet was plentiful, with yummy treats like fresh figs, fresh honey, and the usual pastries, cheeses, meats etc. Toast came out automatically, and there was waiter service for the hot food. Yes, you got 'one egg' if you ordered the poached, but I'm sure you can order more if need be. My beans on toast came out with 4 tiny triangles of toast with the crusts cut off, arranged around a small pot of beans. I guess the restaurants theme is the appearance of the food rather than the quantity, but the overall quality was fantastic. All in all, we had a very pleasant stay in a good standard 4* hotel for a bargain price. We'll certainly consider going there again next time we want a quick get-away.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Surprise
Wonderful wedding venue
reviews.text: My daughter and her new husband had their wedding reception here at the end of October. We had a wonderful day. The organisation was excellent, the food delicious and the service brilliant. All the staff were polite, helpful and competent. The rooms were comfortable and everyone who stayed (and there were a large number of us) said they would stay at the Bush again.

reviews.title: Wow!
reviews.text: We have just had our wedding reception at The Bush and wanted to write a review to defend the hotel from the couple of other complanits about it on this site so that readers don't get the wrong impression!
The hotel itself is lovely with lots of interesting historical features (see the indoor ceiling sundial in the oak lounge) and is also in the centre of farnham which is a lovely town.
reviews.title: A little better than the Salvation Army!!
Disappointing
reviews.text: The service could not have been any better either on our wedding day (thankyou hiney and team!) or on the numerous occasions that we visited the hotel for lunch, afternoon tea and to check wedding details with Diane the coordinator.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after attending a wedding in the area and were very disappointed. On the website the hotel looked really lovely however we found it to be pretty shabby and felt that the £160 B&B rate was certainly not deserved. We waited about 15 minutes to check in which was not great as we were in a rush. Some people's rooms were not even ready and it was mid afternoon. The room was OK but the bathroom was really old and tatty and not particularly clean, we were only given two small hand towels. Breakfas was included in the price, the buffet bit was fine but the cooked food was a real let down with tiny portions, I ordered poached eggs with beans, mushrooms and tomato and literlly got 1 mushroom and half a tomato ( we also had a 40 minute wait for this). Feel a bit ripped off but we should have checked Tripadvisor prior to booking.
reviews.title: Really disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Evidently a busy hotel in a town setting. The food was such a let down. We ordered a plowman's lunch from the bar menu at nearly £10 a go and it was just a joke. Tiny amount of dried up cheese and celery. Three mingy (tiny) slices of white dry bread. A teeny tiny pot of pickle. The barman serving us said it was not his problem! Pathetic in such a hotel. We got disturbed by the disco from the wedding in the hotel. We went to bed after midnight but the noise from the rowdy wedding guests and disco up kept us awake. A drunk guest called us in the middle of the night (4am). As requested my medium boiled egg at breakfast arrived watery inside. Sort it out Macdonald hotel company or we (and others) just will never be back. You have to watch the type of people you attract at low room rates and in wedding groups as they will put of regular clientelle who pay nearly full price.
reviews.title: smallest plowman's lunch in the world

reviews.text: On a slight positive note we found the room to be clean and tidy.
reviews.title: Classical lodgings

reviews.text: Booked into the Bush on the recommendation of a seasoned traveller. It's much more interesting than your average concrete block of hotel rooms.
reviews.title: Will Not be staying here again
Polite and helpful staff
reviews.text: I was give a small suite in a corner of the hotel, with a really comfy bed and excellent blackout curtains.

description: Mercure Farnham Bush hotel is located in the centre of Farnham, a very short walking distance from the railway station. The Hotel is only 15 minutes drive to Farnborough Airport, around 30 minutes from Heathrow Airport and 35 minutes from Gatwick. Thackery's Restaurant serves modern European cuisine, and the Coachman's Bar is a cosy spot for a nightcap. The 6 fully equipped function rooms can host varying events from small meetings in a boardroom style right up to 140 people for conferences, parties and weddings.
